lines.content: *"I'm going to be the world's greatest swordsman! And now I'll help you become the most organized person!"* - Roronoa Zoro (probably)
[E] [ ] meet up with someone (from: tomorrow 2pm, to: 4pm)
*"Listen up! Here's how you manage tasks like a proper swordsman."*
Run the application and you'll see the main menu. Type **2** to start managing tasks, or **1** to test the echo feature.
What can I do for you?
1: echo - I'll repeat what you say
2: task - Let's get your schedule sharper than my blades
Perfect for simple tasks without time constraints.
Use when you have a specific due date or time limit.
For appointments, meetings, or time-blocked activities.
Shows your complete task list with checkboxes and details.
Toggle task #2 between done ✓ and not done. Use the number from your task list.
Permanently removes task #1 from your list.
Shows all tasks containing the word "meeting".
- **Task numbers change** when you delete tasks - always check `list` first
- **Keywords matter**: Use `/by` for deadlines, `/from` and `/to` for events
- **Case sensitive**: Commands are lowercase, but task descriptions can be anything
- **Get lost?** Type `menu` to return to the main screen anytime
*Your tasks are automatically saved. Now get to work and become the greatest task-master!*
[E] [ ] this thing next week (from: wed, to: thurs)
* Main application class for the Zoro task management system.

* @param state - the current state to handle

* Saves the current list of tasks to file.
* Each task is written as a separate line using its toString() method.

* @return - the reconstructed Task object, or null if parsing fails
* Enum representing the different states of the Zoro application.
* Used to control the main application flow and determine which mode is active.

* Prints instructions for the echo mode.
"Type something and I will echo it!\n" +

"Listen up! Here's how you manage tasks like a proper swordsman:\n" +
"a) todo [task] - Basic training, one task at a time\n" +
* Prints the correct format for todo command.
System.out.println("Proper form: todo [task] - Like 'todo practice sword techniques'");
* Prints the correct format for mark command.
System.out.println("Proper form: mark [task_number] - Pick the right target!");
* Prints the correct format for deadline command.
System.out.println("Proper form: deadline [task] /by [deadline_day] - Set your training goals!");
* Prints the correct format for event command.
System.out.println("Proper form: event [event] /from [startTime] /to [endTime] - Schedule like a warrior!");
* Prints the correct format for delete command.
* Prints the correct format for find command.
* Prints confirmation message when a task is marked as done.
* @param userInput - the task description that was marked
System.out.println("Task " + userInput + " has been conquered. Time for the next challenge!");
* Prints confirmation message when a new task is added.
* @param task - the task that was added
* Prints confirmation message when a task is unmarked (marked as not done).
* @param userInput - the task description that was unmarked
System.out.println("Task " + userInput + " is back in action. Sometimes you gotta fight the same battle twice.");
* Prints confirmation message when a task is deleted.
* @param task - the task that was deleted
* Prints the list of tasks found by a search.
* @param tasks - the list of tasks that matched the search criteria
System.out.println("I got pretty lost looking for these:");
System.out.println("I think I got lost, I couldn't find anything!");
* Prints the complete list of all tasks.
* @param tasks - the list of all current tasks
System.out.println("No tasks? Are you staying on top of your work or are you slacking off?");
System.out.println("If you want to become the greatest swordsman theres no time for slacking - get to work.");
* Prints goodbye message when exiting the application.
* Prints error message for invalid user input.
System.out.println("That's not a valid input, you're really starting to act like that stupid chef.");

* @param errorMessage - the specific error message to display
System.out.println("Fix your form and try again!");
* Utility class for validating user input commands.

return ValidationResult.fail("You can't train without knowing what you're training for. " +
"Tell me what task you need to do.");
return ValidationResult.fail("That's as empty as my sense of direction. " +
* Validates mark command format and checks if task index exists.

* @param tasks - the current list of tasks to check index against
* @return - ValidationResult indicating success or failure with error message
public static ValidationResult validateMarkCommand(String userInput, List<Task> tasks) {
return ValidationResult.fail("Which task are you marking? I may get lost easily, " +
"but at least I know what I'm looking for.");
return ValidationResult.fail("That index doesn't exist. Even I wouldn't get that lost.");
return  ValidationResult.fail("Use numbers, not letters. I may use swords," +
" but I still know how to count.");

"Your deadline command is missing parts - fix it!");
return ValidationResult.fail("Where's the '/by' keyword? Even Sanji could follow instructions" +
" It's like sword stance - order matters.");
return ValidationResult.fail("You put '/by' but forgot the actual deadline." +
"That's like drawing your sword and not swinging it.");
return ValidationResult.fail("Empty description? I don't train for nothing," +
" and you shouldn't schedule nothing either.");
return ValidationResult.fail("No deadline given? How are you supposed to" +
* Validates event command format including /from and /to keyword placement.
* @param userInput - the user input string to validate
* @return - ValidationResult indicating success or failure with error message
return ValidationResult.fail("This command is weaker than my sense of direction." +
return ValidationResult.fail("Missing '/from' keyword. Every battle has a start -" +
return ValidationResult.fail("Missing '/to' keyword. Every training session has an end" +
" It's like announcing your attack before you strike.");
return ValidationResult.fail("Don't end with keywords. That's like stopping mid-sword swing.");
return ValidationResult.fail("'from' should come before '/to'. Even I know that much about directions.");
return ValidationResult.fail("Empty fields are like dull blades - useless. Fill them all in properly");

return ValidationResult.fail("That's as empty as my sense of direction. " +
